original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_It is better to be patient than powerful; it is better have self_

_control than to conquer a city. _(Pro 16:32)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Self-control is superior to conquest. Success in business, school,

or home life can be ruined by a person who loses control of his or

her temper. So it is a great personal victory to control your temper.

When you feel yourself ready to explode, remember that losing control

may cause you to forfeit what you want most.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remember to look to You each

day for greater patients, when I feel the urge to explode. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Self-control is superior to conquest. Success in business, school, or home life can be ruined by a person who loses control of his or her temper. So it is a great personal victory to control your temper. When you feel yourself ready to explode, remember that losing control may cause you to forfeit what you want most.
original_verse_text: It is better to be patient than powerful; it is better have self control than to conquer a city.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of self-control, which is a fruit of Your Holy Spirit. Help us to walk in the power of Your Spirit, that we may be slow to anger and quick to show gentleness, patience, and kindness, even in the face of provocation. Grant us the wisdom to rule our own spirits, that we may not lose what matters most. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Self-control is superior to conquest. Success in business, school, or home life can be ruined by a person who loses control of his or her temper. So it is a great personal victory to control your temper. When you feel yourself ready to explode, remember that losing control may cause you to forfeit what you want most.
subject: Mastering Self-Control Leads to Success
verse_text: It is better to be patient than powerful; it is better have self control than to conquer a city.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A dry crust eaten in peace is better than a great feast with
strife._

(Pro 17:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Which would you sooner have, a bowl of soup with someone you

love, or a steak with someone you hate? What God wants from us

is to build on a foundation of love! ! !

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to build on a foundation of love

so that no mater what I eat or who I eat is with I will feel I have

been blest by You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Which would you sooner have, a bowl of soup with someone you love, or a steak with someone you hate? What God wants from us is to build on a foundation of love! ! !
original_verse_text: A dry crust eaten in peace is better than a great feast with strife.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of fellowship and the power of Your love to unite us. Help us to walk in humility, gentleness, and patience, bearing with one another in love, and making every effort to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace. May our relationships be marked by the grace and peace that come from You, Lord. Amen.
reflection: Which would you sooner have, a bowl of soup with someone you love, or a steak with someone you hate? What God wants from us is to build on a foundation of love!
subject: Cultivate Love, Not Hate
verse_text: A dry crust eaten in peace is better than a great feast with strife.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who acts_

_shamefully. _(Pro. 17:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A wise servant could be given authority and even freed by

his master. Servants in the ancient world often had oversight

over young heirs, and might even inherit a masters estate in

the absence of a biological son. What this proverb cautions

is not to always rely on privilege and position.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that my behavior will always be pleasing

to You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: A wise servant could be given authority and even freed by his master. Servants in the ancient world often had oversight over young heirs, and might even inherit a masters estate in the absence of a biological son. What this proverb cautions is not to always rely on privilege and position.
original_verse_text: A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who acts shamefully.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your wisdom and the guidance found in Your Word. Help us to be faithful and diligent in our service, not relying on privilege or position, but seeking to honor You in all we do. Grant us discernment to steward the responsibilities You entrust to us, that we may be found trustworthy and pleasing in Your sight. May we faithfully tend to the tasks and people You have placed under our care. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: A wise servant could be given authority and even freed by his master. Servants in the ancient world often had oversight over young heirs, and might even inherit a master's estate in the absence of a biological son. What this proverb cautions is not to always rely on privilege and position.
subject: Faithful Servants Earn Trust
verse_text: A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who acts shamefully.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the Lord_

_tests the heart. _(Pro. 17:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It takes intense heat to purify gold and silver. Similarly it

takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be purified. through

trials. By them God shows us what is in us and clears out anything that gets in the way of complete trust in Him. So when

tough times come our way, realize that God wants to use them

to refine your faith and purify your heart.

PRAYER FOR TODAY;

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to understand what you are

trying to tell me when trials come my way. Amen.
original_reflection_text: It takes intense heat to purify gold and silver. Similarly it takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be purified. through trials. By them God shows us what is in us and clears out anything that gets in the way of complete trust in Him. So when tough times come our way, realize that God wants to use them to refine your faith and purify your heart.
original_verse_text: Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the Lord tests the heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that the trials we face are like the refiner's fire, purifying our faith and drawing us closer to You. Just as gold and silver are tested by intense heat, so too are our hearts tested through the difficulties of life. Lord, help us to endure these trials with patience and trust, knowing that You are using them to refine our character and deepen our dependence on You. May our faith emerge stronger, our hearts more pure, and our love for You more steadfast. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: It takes intense heat to purify gold and silver. Similarly, it takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be purified through trials. By them, God shows us what is in us and clears out anything that gets in the way of complete trust in Him. So when tough times come our way, realize that God wants to use them to refine your faith and purify your heart.
subject: Refining Faith Through Trials
verse_text: Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the Lord tests the heart.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Those who mock the poor insult their maker, those who rejoice _

_at the misfortune of others will be punished. _(Pro. 17:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Few facts are as cruel as making fun of the less fortunate, BUT

many people do this because it makes them feel good to be

better off or more successful than someone else. Mocking the

poor is mocking God. who made them. We also ridicule God

when we mock the weak, those who are different, or anyone else.

When you catch yourself putting others down just for fun, stop

and think about Who created them.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I put my mouth in gear

before thinking it was You who created them. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Few facts are as cruel as making fun of the less fortunate, BUT many people do this because it makes them feel good to be better off or more successful than someone else. Mocking the poor is mocking God. who made them. We also ridicule God when we mock the weak, those who are different, or anyone else. When you catch yourself putting others down just for fun, stop and think about Who created them.
original_verse_text: Those who mock the poor insult their maker, those who rejoice at the misfortune of others will be punished.
prayer: Heavenly Father, forgive us when we mock or ridicule the less fortunate, for in doing so, we mock You who created them. Help us to have compassion and care for the poor and weak, remembering that they are Your beloved children. May we never find pleasure in putting others down, but instead seek to uplift and encourage all people, for they bear Your image. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Few facts are as cruel as making fun of the less fortunate, but many people do this because it makes them feel good to be better off or more successful than someone else. Mocking the poor is mocking God, who made them. We also ridicule God when we mock the weak, those who are different, or anyone else. When you catch yourself putting others down just for fun, stop and think about who created them.
subject: Mocking the Less Fortunate
verse_text: Those who mock the poor insult their maker, those who rejoice at the misfortune of others will be punished.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A bribe seems to work like magic for those who give it; they_

_succeed in all they do__. _(Proverbs 17:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon is certainly not condoning bribery, but he is making

an observation about the way the world operates. Bribes may

get people what they want, but the Bible clearly condemns

using them (Mt. 28:11-15)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always seek Your honest advise

when I am tempted to do something that may cause me to sin. .Amen.
original_reflection_text: Solomon is certainly not condoning bribery, but he is making an observation about the way the world operates. Bribes may get people what they want, but the Bible clearly condemns using them (Matthew 28:11-15)
original_verse_text: A bribe seems to work like magic for those who give it; they succeed in all they do.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the temptation to seek worldly gain and the fleeting pleasures it may bring. Help us to resist the allure of bribes and the false promises of material wealth, for our true treasure is found in You alone. May our hearts be fixed on the eternal riches of Your kingdom, where moth and rust do not destroy, and where thieves cannot break in and steal. Guide us to store up treasures in heaven, where our hearts will be aligned with Yours. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Solomon is certainly not condoning bribery, but he is making an observation about the way the world operates. Bribes may get people what they want, but the Bible clearly condemns using them (Matthew 28:11-15).
subject: Bribes Influence Outcomes, But
verse_text: A bribe seems to work like magic for those who give it; they succeed in all they do.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Disregarding another person's faults preserves love;_

_telling about them separates close friends._ (Pro. 17:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This proverb is saying that we should be willing to

disregard the faults of others. Covering over offenses is

necessary to any relationship. It is tempting, especially

in an argument, to bring up all the mistakes the other

person has ever made. We should be careful to try not

to bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to

the topic being discussed. As we grow to be more like

Christ, we will acquire God's ability to forget confessed

sins of the past.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would have a more forgiving heart,

so that I would become more Christ like each day. Amen.
original_reflection_text: This proverb is saying that we should be willing to disregard the faults of others. Covering over offenses is necessary to any relationship. It is tempting, especially in an argument, to bring up all the mistakes the other person has ever made. We should be careful to try not to bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to the topic being discussed. As we grow to be more like Christ, we will acquire God's ability to forget confessed sins of the past.
original_verse_text: Disregarding another person's faults preserves love; telling about them separates close friends.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your guidance in our relationships. Help us to be patient and kind, bearing with one another in love, as Your Word instructs. Grant us the wisdom to cover over offenses, not dwelling on the faults of others, but instead extending grace and forgiveness. May we grow in Your likeness, quick to forget confessed sins and slow to hold grudges. Lord, transform our hearts to reflect Your compassion and mercy. Amen.
reflection: This proverb is saying that we should be willing to disregard the faults of others. Covering over offenses is necessary to any relationship. It is tempting, especially in an argument, to bring up all the mistakes the other person has ever made. We should be careful to try not to bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to the topic being discussed. As we grow to be more like Christ, we will acquire God's ability to forget confessed sins of the past.
subject: Covering Offenses Restores Relationships
verse_text: Disregarding another person's faults preserves love; telling about them separates close friends.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A friend is always loyal; and a brother is born to help_

_in time of need. _(Pro. 17:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What kind of friend are you? There is a vast difference between

knowing someone well and being a true friend. The greatest

evidence of genuine friendship is loyalty, being available to help

in times of distress or personal struggle. To many people are fairweather friends. They stick around when the friendship helps

THEM and leave when they are not getting anything out of the

relationship. Be the kind of true friend the Bible encourages.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always be truly loyal to

all my friends. Amen.
original_reflection_text: What kind of friend are you? There is a vast difference between knowing someone well and being a true friend. The greatest evidence of genuine friendship is loyalty, being available to help in times of distress or personal struggle. To many people are fairweather friends. They stick around when the friendship helps THEM and leave when they are not getting anything out of the relationship. Be the kind of true friend the Bible encourages.
original_verse_text: A friend is always loyal; and a brother is born to help in time of need.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of true friendship and the example of loyalty found in Your Word. Help us to be the kind of friend who sticks closer than a brother, who is available to support and encourage others in times of need. May we reflect Your love and faithfulness in our relationships, and may our friendships be a testament to the power of Your Spirit working in our lives. Amen.
reflection: What kind of friend are you? There is a vast difference between knowing someone well and being a true friend. The greatest evidence of genuine friendship is loyalty, being available to help in times of distress or personal struggle. Too many people are fair-weather friends. They stick around when the friendship helps THEM and leave when they are not getting anything out of the relationship. Be the kind of true friend the Bible encourages.
subject: Be a Loyal, Steadfast Friend
verse_text: A friend is always loyal; and a brother is born to help in time of need.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Anyone who loves to quarrel loves sin; anyone who speaks _

_boastfully __invites disaster. _(Pro. 17:19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Good people enjoy the positive results of their words, BUT

those who are treacherous seem to crave violence.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will always instill in

me a positive attitude, always speaking well of others. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Good people enjoy the positive results of their words, BUT those who are treacherous seem to crave violence.
original_verse_text: Anyone who loves to quarrel loves sin; anyone who speaks boastfully invites disaster.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our words hold powerâ€”the power to build up or tear down. Help us, Lord, to use our speech to bring forth Your light and love, rather than to indulge in violence or treachery. May our lips speak words of life, that we may reap the bountiful harvest of Your goodness. Guide us, O God, to walk in the way of the righteous, that our lives may bear witness to Your grace. Amen.
reflection: Good people enjoy the positive results of their words, BUT those who are treacherous seem to crave violence.
subject: Positive Words Vs. Violent Cravings
verse_text: Anyone who loves to quarrel loves sin; anyone who speaks boastfully invites disaster.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a broken spirit saps a_

_person's strength. _(Pro. 17:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

To be cheerful is to be ready to greet others with a welcome,

a word of encouragement, an enthusiasm for the task at hand,

and a positive out look on the future. Such people are as welcome,

as pain-relieving medicine.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be ready to greet others

with a word of encouragement, and a positive out look on the

future. Forgive me when I'm lees then encouraging. Amen.
original_reflection_text: To be cheerful is to be ready to greet others with a welcome, a word of encouragement, an enthusiasm for the task at hand, and a positive out look on the future. Such people are as welcome, as pain-relieving medicine.
original_verse_text: A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a broken spirit saps a person's strength.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You have created us to be joyful and to spread Your light in this world. Help us to cultivate a spirit of cheerfulness, that we may be a source of encouragement and comfort to those around us. May we approach each day with enthusiasm and a positive outlook, reflecting the joy that comes from knowing You. Guide us to be ready to greet others with a welcoming spirit, that we may bring Your healing and peace to all we encounter. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: To be cheerful is to be ready to greet others with a welcome, a word of encouragement, an enthusiasm for the task at hand, and a positive outlook on the future. Such people are as welcome as pain-relieving medicine.
subject: Cheerful Greetings Uplift Others
verse_text: A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a broken spirit saps a person's strength.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Sensible people keep their eyes glued on wisdom, but a fool's_

_wonder to the ends of the earth. _(Pro. 17:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

There is something to be said about having dreams, Lord knows

I have had my share, but this proverb points out the folly of

chasing fantasies. I have found that it is better to align your

goals with God's, being the kind of person He wants you to be!

Take time to think about your dreams and goals, and make sure

they cover the really important areas of life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Lord, help me to tackle everything on my plate today with grace,

and enthusiasm, knowing that my attitude may effect others in

ways I'm not even aware of. Amen.
original_reflection_text: There is something to be said about having dreams, Lord knows I have had my share, but this proverb points out the folly of chasing fantasies. I have found that it is better to align your goals with God's, being the kind of person He wants you to be! Take time to think about your dreams and goals, and make sure they cover the really important areas of life.
original_verse_text: Sensible people keep their eyes glued on wisdom, but a fool's wonder to the ends of the earth.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to align our dreams and goals with Your perfect will. Help us to focus not on chasing fantasies, but on becoming the people You have called us to be. May we trust in You, committing our works to You, so that our plans may be established according to Your purpose. Guide us, Lord, to pursue what is truly important in Your sight. Amen.
reflection: There is something to be said about having dreams, Lord knows I have had my share, but this proverb points out the folly of chasing fantasies. I have found that it is better to align your goals with God's, being the kind of person He wants you to be! Take time to think about your dreams and goals, and make sure they cover the really important areas of life.
subject: Align Your Dreams with God's
verse_text: Sensible people keep their eyes glued on wisdom, but a fool's wonder to the ends of the earth.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Even fools are thought to be wise when they keep silent;_

_when they keep their mouths shut, they seem intelligent._

THOUGHT FOR TODAY;

_When we talk to much and listen to little we communicate to_

_others that we think our ideas are much more important then_

_theirs. The Bible advices us to reverse this process. When we_

_find ourselves acting out this in our lives we need to put a_

_stop-watch on our conversations, and keep track of how much _

_we talk and how much we listen._

_PRAYER FOR TODAY:_

_Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a better listener. Amen. _
original_reflection_text: When we talk to much and listen to little we communicate to others that we think our ideas are much more important then theirs. The Bible advice's us to reverse this process. When we find ourselves acting out this in our lives we need to put a stopwatch on our conversations, and keep track of how much we talk and how much we listen.
original_verse_text: Even fools are thought to be wise when they keep silent; when they keep their mouths shut, they seem intelligent.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that in our eagerness to speak, we often fail to listen. Help us to be slow to speak and quick to hear, as Your Word instructs. May we be mindful of the wisdom found in restraint, that we may honor You and build up those around us. Grant us the grace to be attentive listeners, valuing the thoughts and perspectives of others. In all our conversations, may we reflect Your love and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: When we talk to much and listen to little we communicate to others that we think our ideas are much more important then theirs. The Bible advice's us to reverse this process. When we find ourselves acting out this in our lives we need to put a stopwatch on our conversations, and keep track of how much we talk and how much we listen.
subject: Speak Less, Listen More
verse_text: Even fools are thought to be wise when they keep silent; when they keep their mouths shut, they seem intelligent.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Fools have very little interest in understanding; they only want _

_to air their own opinions. _ (Pro. 18:2_)_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Lord approves of those who are good, but He condemns

those who have evil plans. only the godly have deep roots.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly, I pray that I will not fall under Your condemnation

Amen.
original_reflection_text: The Lord approves of those who are good, but He condemns those who have evil plans. only the godly have deep roots.
original_verse_text: Fools have very little interest in understanding; they only want to air their own opinions.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Your Word reminds us that You approve of those who are good, but You condemn those with evil plans. Help us, Lord, to have deep roots in Your righteousness, to walk in Your ways, and to bear the fruit of Your Spirit. May our lives be a testament to Your goodness and a reflection of Your love. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The Lord approves of those who are good, but He condemns those who have evil plans. Only the godly have deep roots.
subject: Godly Roots, Evil Plans Condemned
verse_text: Fools have very little interest in understanding; they only want to air their own opinions.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_People ruin their lives by their own foolishness and then become_

_ angry at the Lord. _(Pro. 19:3

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

People continually blame God for their self-induced problems.

How do you handle unpleasant results of your own choices?

Where do you fix the blame? Instead of blaming God, look for

ways to grow through your bad choices and failures.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, please forgive me for making my own

plans, and when they fail I have the tendency to blame You.

Help me to always look to You for wisdom. Amen.
original_reflection_text: People continually blame God for their self-induced problems. How do you handle unpleasant results of your own choices? Where do you fix the blame? Instead of blaming God, look for ways to grow through your bad choices and failures.
original_verse_text: People ruin their lives by their own foolishness and then become angry at the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You acknowledging that too often we blame You for the consequences of our own sinful choices. Forgive us for our pride and unwillingness to take responsibility for our actions. Help us to humbly confess our transgressions, turn from them, and seek Your mercy and restoration. Grant us the wisdom to learn from our mistakes, that we may grow in godliness and walk more closely with You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: People continually blame God for their self-induced problems. How do you handle unpleasant results of your own choices? Where do you fix the blame? Instead of blaming God, look for ways to grow through your bad choices and failures.
subject: Grow Through Your Failures
verse_text: People ruin their lives by their own foolishness and then become angry at the Lord.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A false witness will not go unpunished, nor will a liar_

_escape. _(Pro. 19:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Making up false stories is strictly forbidden by the Lord.

Gossip, slander, and false witnessing undermines families,

strains neighborhood cooperation, and causes chaos of a

justice system. Yes destructive gossip will always cause

problems. Even if you do not initiate a lie, you become

responsible if you pass it along. The best advice is don't

circulate rumors; squelch them before they get started.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for the many blessings You have given

since the creation of the world, even though we are far from

deserving of even one. I pray that You would open the eyes of

us all so that we may turn our lives back over to You. Help

us to be faithful I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Making up false stories is strictly forbidden by the Lord. Gossip, slander, and false witnessing undermines families, strains neighborhood cooperation, and causes chaos of a justice system. Yes destructive gossip will always cause problems. Even if you do not initiate a lie, you become responsible if you pass it along. The best advice is don't circulate rumors; squelch them before they get started.
original_verse_text: A false witness will not go unpunished, nor will a liar escape.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the weight of Your command against false witness and deceitful speech. Help us to guard our tongues, that we may not participate in the spreading of rumors, slander, or malicious gossip that sows discord and undermines the unity You desire for Your people. Grant us the wisdom to discern truth from falsehood, and the courage to stand firm in Your ways, even when it is difficult. May our words and actions always bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Making up false stories is strictly forbidden by the Lord. Gossip, slander, and false witnessing undermine families, strain neighborhood cooperation, and cause chaos in a justice system. Yes, destructive gossip will always cause problems. Even if you do not initiate a lie, you become responsible if you pass it along. The best advice is: don't circulate rumors; squelch them before they get started.
subject: Avoid Destructive Gossip
verse_text: A false witness will not go unpunished, nor will a liar escape.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_People with good sense restrain their anger; they earn_

_esteem by overlooking wrongs. _(Pro. 19:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A quick temper can be like a fire out of control. It can burn us

and everyone else in its path. Anger divides people. It pushes

us into hasty decisions that only causes bitterness and guilt. Yet

anger, in itself, is not wrong. Anger can be a legitimate reaction

to injustice and sin. When you feel yourself getting angry, look

for the cause. Are you reacting to an evil situation that you are

going to set right? Or are you responding to a personal insult?

PRAY FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray that You will help me control a

quick temper, channel my feelings into effective action so that

I may conquer selfish anger through humility and repentance.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: A quick temper can be like a fire out of control. It can burn us and everyone else in its path. Anger divides people. It pushes us into hasty decisions that only causes bitterness and guilt. Yet anger, in itself, is not wrong. Anger can be a legitimate reaction to injustice and sin. When you feel yourself getting angry, look for the cause. Are you reacting to an evil situation that you are going to set right? Or are you responding to a personal insult?
original_verse_text: People with good sense restrain their anger; they earn esteem by overlooking wrongs.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the power of our emotions and the temptation to let anger consume us. Help us to be slow to anger, as Your Word instructs, and quick to seek understanding and reconciliation. May we not sin in our anger, but rather use it to stand against injustice and sin, while also extending grace to those who have wronged us. Guide us, Lord, to respond with wisdom and patience, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: A quick temper can be like a fire out of control. It can burn us and everyone else in its path. Anger divides people. It pushes us into hasty decisions that only cause bitterness and guilt. Yet anger, in itself, is not wrong. Anger can be a legitimate reaction to injustice and sin. When you feel yourself getting angry, look for the cause. Are you reacting to an evil situation that you are going to set right? Or are you responding to a personal insult?
subject: Tame Your Fiery Temper
verse_text: People with good sense restrain their anger; they earn esteem by overlooking wrongs.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Keep the commandments and keep your life; despising_

_them leads to death. _(Pro. 19:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The commandments we are told to obey are those in God's

Word, such as the Ten Commandments (Ex, 20) and other

passages of instruction. To obey what God teaches in the

Bible is self-preserving. to disobey is self-destructive.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your Holy Spirit's guidance

so that I may always keep Your commandments and Your other

instructions. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The commandments we are told to obey are those in God's Word, such as the Ten Commandments (Exodus, 20) and other passages of instruction. To obey what God teaches in the Bible is self-preserving. to disobey is self-destructive.
original_verse_text: Keep the commandments and keep your life; despising them leads to death.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the wisdom and guidance found in Your Word. Help us to heed the commandments and instructions You have graciously provided, that we may live in accordance with Your will and experience the blessings You have promised. May we hold fast to the truth that You are the one true God, and that obedience to Your ways leads to life and prosperity. Grant us the strength and discernment to walk faithfully in Your statutes. Amen.
reflection: The commandments we are told to obey are those in God's Word, such as the Ten Commandments (Exodus 20) and other passages of instruction. To obey what God teaches in the Bible is self-preserving. To disobey is self-destructive.
subject: Obey God's Commandments, Live
verse_text: Keep the commandments and keep your life; despising them leads to death.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If you help the poor, you are lending to the Lord,_

_and He will repay you. _(Pro 19:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Here God identifies with the poor as Jesus does in (Mt. 25:31-46).

As our Creator, God values all of us, whether we are poor or rich.

When we help the poor, we horror both the Creator and His creation.

God accepts our help as if we had offered it directly to Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to look upon all people equally.

Help me to reach out to all in need no matter what their status

may be. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Here God identifies with the poor as Jesus does in (Matthew 25:31-46). As our Creator, God values all of us, whether we are poor or rich. When we help the poor, we horror both the Creator and His creation. God accepts our help as if we had offered it directly to Him.
original_verse_text: If you help the poor, you are lending to the Lord, and He will repay you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we have is a gift from Your gracious hand. Help us to see the poor and needy as You see them - as Your beloved children, created in Your image. May we honor You by extending compassion and aid to those in need, knowing that in doing so, we serve You. Give us open eyes and willing hands to be Your instruments of love and justice in this world. We pray this in the name of Your Son, Jesus. Amen.
reflection: Here God identifies with the poor as Jesus does in (Matthew 25:31-46). As our Creator, God values all of us, whether we are poor or rich. When we help the poor, we honor both the Creator and His creation. God accepts our help as if we had offered it directly to Him.
subject: Honoring God by Helping the Poor
verse_text: If you help the poor, you are lending to the Lord, and He will repay you.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_You can make many plans, but the Lord's purpose will prevail._

(Pro. 19:21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Are you frustrated with the inconsistencies of other or even in

yourself? God is completely trustworthy, His intensions never

change. There is a promise that what ever is good and perfect

comes to us from the Creator who never changes (Jm. 1:17).

When you wonder if there is anyone you can trust, remember

that God is completely consistent. We need to let Him counsel

us.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I know in my heart that You are trustworthy

but there are times I need to be reminded, because in my human

nature I become impatient and run out ahead of You. Forgive me

for my sins. AMEN.
original_reflection_text: Are you frustrated with the inconsistencies of other or even in yourself? God is completely trustworthy, His intentions never change. There is a promise that what ever is good and perfect comes to us from the Creator who never changes (James 1:17). When you wonder if there is anyone you can trust, remember that God is completely consistent. We need to let Him counsel us.
original_verse_text: You can make many plans, but the Lord's purpose will prevail.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, for You are the same yesterday, today, and forever. In a world of constant change and uncertainty, we find comfort in the knowledge that Your plans and purposes never waver. Help us to trust in Your steadfast love, to seek Your counsel, and to find our security in Your unchanging nature. May we rest in the assurance that Your intentions for us are always good and perfect, even when we cannot fully understand Your ways. We surrender our lives to You, Lord, for You alone are worthy of our trust. Amen.
reflection: Are you frustrated with the inconsistencies of others or even in yourself? God is completely trustworthy; His intentions never change. There is a promise that whatever is good and perfect comes to us from the Creator who never changes (James 1:17). When you wonder if there is anyone you can trust, remember that God is completely consistent. We need to let Him counsel us.
subject: Consistent God, Unchanging Intentions
verse_text: You can make many plans, but the Lord's purpose will prevail.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If you punish a mocker, the simpleminded will learn a lesson,_

_if you reprove the wise, the will be all the smarter._ (Pro. 19:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

There is a great difference between the person who learns from

criticism and the person who refuses to accept correction. How

we respond to criticism determines whether or not we grow in

wisdom. The next time someone criticizes you, listen carefully

to all that is said. You might learn something.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always accept constructive

criticism. Amen.
original_reflection_text: There is a great difference between the person who learns from criticism and the person who refuses to accept correction. How we respond to criticism determines whether or not we grow in wisdom. The next time someone criticizes you, listen carefully to all that is said. You might learn something.
original_verse_text: If you punish a mocker, the simpleminded will learn a lesson, if you reprove the wise, the will be all the smarter.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to receive criticism with open minds and receptive spirits, that we may grow in understanding and become more like Your Son. Grant us the discernment to distinguish between constructive feedback and harmful words, that we may learn and improve, not become hardened or defensive. May we be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to anger, that we may walk the path of true wisdom. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: There is a great difference between the person who learns from criticism and the person who refuses to accept correction. How we respond to criticism determines whether or not we grow in wisdom. The next time someone criticizes you, listen carefully to all that is said. You might learn something.
subject: Embrace Criticism, Gain Wisdom
verse_text: If you punish a mocker, the simpleminded will learn a lesson, if you reprove the wise, the will be all the smarter.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Mockers will be punished, and the backs of fools will be beaten._

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Wrong assumptions lead to wrong conclusions. We should not

take our limited experiences and jump to conclusions about life

in general. If you find yourself doubting God, remember that you

do not have all the facts. God wants only the very best for your

life. Many people endure great pain, but ultimately they find some

greater good from it. When you're struggling, don't assume the worst.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that You will forgive me when I jump to conclusions

about people and different situations in life. I pray that I will
always

trust in Your advise. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Wrong assumptions lead to wrong conclusions. We should not take our limited experiences and jump to conclusions about life in general. If you find yourself doubting God, remember that you do not have all the facts. God wants only the very best for your life. Many people endure great pain, but ultimately they find some greater good from it. When you're struggling, don't assume the worst.
original_verse_text: Mockers will be punished, and the backs of fools will be beaten.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our understanding is limited and our assumptions can lead us astray. Help us to trust in Your perfect plan for our lives, even when the path is difficult and the way is unclear. Remind us of Your promise in Jeremiah 29:11, that You have plans to prosper us and not to harm us, plans to give us hope and a future. May we cling to this truth, even in our darkest moments, and find comfort in the knowledge that Your ways are higher than our own. We surrender our doubts and fears to You, Lord, and ask that You would guide us with Your wisdom and grace. Amen.
reflection: Wrong assumptions lead to wrong conclusions. We should not take our limited experiences and jump to conclusions about life in general. If you find yourself doubting God, remember that you do not have all the facts. God wants only the very best for your life. Many people endure great pain, but ultimately they find some greater good from it. When you're struggling, don't assume the worst.
subject: Overcome Wrong Assumptions
verse_text: Mockers will be punished, and the backs of fools will be beaten.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Who can say, "I have cleansed my heart; I am pure and free _

_from sin. _(Pro. 20:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

No one is without sin. As soon as we confess our sins and repent,

sinful thoughts and actions begin to creep back into our life. We

all need ongoing cleansing. We need to thank God that He is a

merciful God who provides forgiveness by His mercy when we

ask for it. We need to make confession and repentance a regular

part of our talks with God. We need to rely on Him for the cleansing

we need.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord for the assurance we have that You hear our

confessions and that You promise to forgive us when we repent

of our sins. Amen.
original_reflection_text: No one is without sin. As soon as we confess our sins and repent, sinful thoughts and actions begin to creep back into our life. We all need ongoing cleansing. We need to thank God that He is a merciful God who provides forgiveness by His mercy when we ask for it. We need to make confession and repentance a regular part of our talks with God. We need to rely on Him for the cleansing we need.
original_verse_text: Who can say, "I have cleansed my heart; I am pure and free from sin.
prayer: Gracious Heavenly Father, we come before You acknowledging that we are all sinful and in need of Your cleansing. We thank You for Your unfailing mercy and the forgiveness that is ours when we confess our sins and turn from our wicked ways. Help us to make confession and repentance a regular part of our lives, that we may be continually cleansed and restored by Your grace. Lord, we rely on You alone for the cleansing we so desperately need. Amen.
reflection: No one is without sin. As soon as we confess our sins and repent, sinful thoughts and actions begin to creep back into our lives. We all need ongoing cleansing. We need to thank God that He is a merciful God who provides forgiveness by His mercy when we ask for it. We need to make confession and repentance a regular part of our talks with God. We need to rely on Him for the cleansing we need.
subject: Ongoing Cleansing Through Confession
verse_text: Who can say, â€œI have cleansed my heart; I am pure and free from sin.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

How can we understand the road we travel? It is the
Lord who directs our steps. (Pro. 20:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are often confused by the events around us. Some things

we will never understand until years later when we look back

and see how God was working. Scriptures tell us we should

not worry if we don't understand every thing as it happens.

Instead, we should trust that God knows what He is doing

even if His timing or design is not clear to us.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not always following your

leading. Help me to be more trusting even when I don't understand

Your plans for us. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We are often confused by the events around us. Some things we will never understand until years later when we look back and see how God was working. Scriptures tell us we should not worry if we don't understand every thing as it happens. Instead, we should trust that God knows what He is doing even if His timing or design is not clear to us.
original_verse_text: How can we understand the road we travel? It is the Lord who directs our steps.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our ways are not always Your ways. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not rely on our own understanding. Guide our steps and make our paths straight, even when the way forward is unclear. We know that Your plans are perfect, and that You are working all things together for our good. Give us the faith to walk by trust, not by sight. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: We are often confused by the events around us. Some things we will never understand until years later when we look back and see how God was working. Scriptures tell us we should not worry if we don't understand everything as it happens. Instead, we should trust that God knows what He is doing even if His timing or design is not clear to us.
subject: Trusting God's Timing and Design
verse_text: How can we understand the road we travel? It is the Lord who directs our steps.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_It is dangerous to make a rash promise to God before_

_counting the cost. _(Pro. 2o:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God takes vows very seriously and requires that they are

carried out (Deut. 23:21-23). We often have good intentions

when making a vow because we want to please God. Jesus,

however, says it is better not to make promises to God

because He knows how difficult they are to keep (Mt. 5:33-37).

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will forgive me for the
promises

I have made and failed to keep. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God takes vows very seriously and requires that they are carried out (Deuteronomy 23:21-23). We often have good intentions when making a vow because we want to please God. Jesus, however, says it is better not to make promises to God because He knows how difficult they are to keep (Matthew 5:33-37).
original_verse_text: It is dangerous to make a rash promise to God before counting the cost.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the weight of the vows we make in Your presence. Forgive us for the times we have made promises hastily, without considering the cost of fulfilling them. Help us to be mindful of the gravity of our words, that we may not speak carelessly, but with reverence and wisdom. May we seek Your guidance before committing to any pledge, that we may honor You with our obedience. Grant us the strength and discernment to keep the vows we make, that our words may not become a snare, but a reflection of our devotion to You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: God takes vows very seriously and requires that they are carried out (Deuteronomy 23:21-23). We often have good intentions when making a vow because we want to please God. Jesus, however, says it is better not to make promises to God because He knows how difficult they are to keep (Matthew 5:33-37).
subject: Keeping Vows Pleases God
verse_text: It is dangerous to make a rash promise to God before counting the cost.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The spirit of man is the lamp of the Lord, searching all_

_his innermost parts. _(Pro. 20:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_SPIRIT "_The breath of life" God breathed into Adams nostrils

distinguishing humankind from all other creatures (Gen. 2:7).

It penetrates, and energizes every human faculty. God judges

the heart and knows who are His. It is a terrible prospect for

God to look at our hearts, considering what lies within.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I realize that You know my heart, and I confess

that my heart is NOT always pleasing to You. Please forgive

me for the uncleanliness that dwells within my heart. Amen.
original_reflection_text: SPIRIT "The breath of life" God breathed into Adams nostrils distinguishing humankind from all other creatures (Genesis 2:7). It penetrates, and energizes every human faculty. God judges the heart and knows who are His. It is a terrible prospect for God to look at our hearts, considering what lies within.
original_verse_text: The spirit of man is the lamp of the Lord, searching all his innermost parts.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the gift of life that You have breathed into us. You have created us in Your own image, endowing us with a spirit that sets us apart from all other creatures. Search our hearts, O Lord, and reveal to us any wickedness or impurity that lies within. Purify us by Your Spirit, that we may walk in a manner worthy of Your calling. May our lives bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: SPIRIT â€œThe breath of lifeâ€ God breathed into Adam's nostrils, distinguishing humankind from all other creatures (Genesis 2:7). It penetrates and energizes every human faculty. God judges the heart and knows who are His. It is a terrible prospect for God to look at our hearts, considering what lies within.
subject: Discerning the Breath of Life
verse_text: The spirit of man is the lamp of the Lord, searching all his innermost parts.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Blows that wound cleanse away evil; stokes make clean the _

_innermost parts. _(Pro. 20:30)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our heavenly Father, disciplines those He loves, WHY? Because

we are all born sinful. That is why we should not be surprised by

our ill manners. God's dear Son became human for our sakes

pierced and lashed to rescue us from sin and to deliver us into

the arms of our Heavenly Father.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that You provided a way

for man to inherit eternal life by faith in Your Son Jesus Christ.

I pray for forgiveness of all my sins. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Our heavenly Father, disciplines those He loves, WHY? Because we are all born sinful. That is why we should not be surprised by our ill manners. God's dear Son became human for our sakes pierced and lashed to rescue us from sin and to deliver us into the arms of our Heavenly Father.
original_verse_text: Blows that wound cleanse away evil; stokes make clean the innermost parts.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our sinful nature and the need for Your loving discipline. Thank You for the gift of Your Son, Jesus, who suffered for our sake to deliver us from the bondage of sin. Guide us through the trials and tribulations of life, that we may grow in wisdom, faith, and obedience to Your will. May Your loving correction mold us into the people You have called us to be. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Our heavenly Father disciplines those He loves. Why? Because we are all born sinful. That is why we should not be surprised by our ill manners. God's dear Son became human for our sakes, pierced and lashed, to rescue us from sin and to deliver us into the arms of our heavenly Father.
subject: Discipline of a Loving Father
verse_text: Blows that wound cleanse away evil; stokes make clean the innermost parts.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the_

_Lord than sacrifices. _(Pro. 21:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Outward ceremonies as such are not useless, sacrificial offerings

of various kinds were required by the Law of Moses. We lay on

God's alter the sacrifice of self-will and the offering of wholeheated consecration. True worship DOES NOT begin with giving

to God but the receiving in humble faith. Then we need to live

in fervent love one to another, especially toward those in need.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, help me to have a fervent love for others, giving of

myself in the likeness of Christ, especially to the needy. .Amen.
original_reflection_text: Outward ceremonies as such are not useless, sacrificial offerings of various kinds were required by the Law of Moses. We lay on God's alter the sacrifice of self-will and the offering of wholehearted consecration. True worship DOES NOT begin with giving to God but the receiving in humble faith. Then we need to live in fervent love one to another, especially toward those in need.
original_verse_text: To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifices.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that true worship is not found in outward ceremonies, but in the sacrifice of our self-will and the offering of our wholehearted consecration. Help us to receive Your grace with faith, that we may live in fervent love towards one another, especially those in need. May our lives reflect Your justice, mercy, and the desire to walk humbly with You. We pray this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Outward ceremonies as such are not useless. Sacrificial offerings of various kinds were required by the Law of Moses. We lay on God's altar the sacrifice of self-will and the offering of wholehearted consecration. True worship does not begin with giving to God but the receiving in humble faith. Then we need to live in fervent love one to another, especially toward those in need.
subject: Receive in Faith, Live in Love
verse_text: To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifices.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The violence of the wicked will sweep them away;_

_because they refuse to do what is just_ (Pro. 21:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Those who have left the right path for the way of evil,

come to enjoy the way they have chosen. Through the

effective working of the DEVIL, what repulses at first

becomes interesting, then acceptable, and finally a

source of sinful delight.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remain faithful in the

reading and studying of Your Word so that I may receive

Your grace through Your Son our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Those who have left the right path for the way of evil, come to enjoy the way they have chosen. Through the effective working of the DEVIL, what repulses at first becomes interesting, then acceptable, and finally a source of sinful delight.
original_verse_text: The violence of the wicked will sweep them away; because they refuse to do what is just.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the deceitfulness of sin and the temptations of the evil one. Help us to walk the path of righteousness, resisting the allure of wickedness that seeks to ensnare us. Grant us the strength to turn away from the ways that lead to destruction, and instead, cling to Your truth and the life-giving power of Your Spirit. May we find our joy and delight in You alone. Amen.
reflection: Those who have left the right path for the way of evil come to enjoy the way they have chosen. Through the effective working of the devil, what repulses at first becomes interesting, then acceptable, and finally a source of sinful delight.
subject: Delight in the Devil's Way
verse_text: The violence of the wicked will sweep them away; because they refuse to do what is just.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_When a scoffer is punished, the simple become wise; when a_

_wise man is instructed, he gains knowledge. _(Pro. 21:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY.

_"SCOFFER" is someone who stubbornly scorns God's wisdom, _

_"THE SIMPLE WILL LEARN PRUDENCE." _Punishment is a deterrent

for the simple who take warning from the fate of the wicked.

Simple people must actually see what consequences come from

disobedience. this is an indictment to us all, we may know well

enough that lawlessness has its price, but we change our behavior

ONLY when the treat of punishment is near.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I don't have to be hit in the

head to realize that there are consequences for those whose

behavior is not in tune with Your will. Amen.
original_reflection_text: "SCOFFER" is someone who stubbornly scorns God's wisdom, "THE SIMPLE WILL LEARN PRUDENCE." Punishment is a deterrent for the simple who take warning from the fate of the wicked. Simple people must actually see what consequences come from disobedience. this is an indictment to us all, we may know well enough that lawlessness has its price, but we change our behavior ONLY when the treat of punishment is near.
original_verse_text: When a scoffer is punished, the simple become wise; when a wise man is instructed, he gains knowledge.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess that we are often like the simple, slow to heed Your wisdom and quick to scorn Your ways. Forgive us for our stubborn hearts and open our eyes to see the consequences of our disobedience. May the fate of the wicked be a deterrent, leading us to walk in prudence and fear of the Lord. Grant us the humility to learn from the punishment of the scoffers, that we may turn from our folly and embrace Your life-giving counsel. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: â€œSCOFFERâ€ is someone who stubbornly scorns God's wisdom. â€œTHE SIMPLE WILL LEARN PRUDENCE.â€ Punishment is a deterrent for the simple who take warning from the fate of the wicked. Simple people must actually see what consequences come from disobedience. This is an indictment to us all. We may know well enough that lawlessness has its price, but we change our behavior only when the threat of punishment is near.
subject: Embrace Hope's Transformation Power
verse_text: When a scoffer is punished, the simple become wise; when a wise man is instructed, he gains knowledge.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A gift in secret averts anger, and a concealed bribe, strong_

_wrath_. (Pro. 21:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"CONCEALED BRIBE" _does not endorse bribery, but points out

the effectiveness of worldly and sinful methods, which God's

people should not encourage (Ro. 12:1-2). Which is worth

reading.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Heavenly Father, for Your mercies in Jesus Christ

and for the transforming work, You began in my Baptism.

Empower me by Your Spirit to present my body as a living

sacrifice of worship acceptable to You in Jesus Christ. Amen
original_reflection_text: "CONCEALED BRIBE" does not endorse bribery, but points out the effectiveness of worldly and sinful methods, which God's people should not encourage (Romans 12:1-2). Which is worth reading.
original_verse_text: A gift in secret averts anger, and a concealed bribe, strong wrath.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the temptations of the world and the allure of sinful methods. Help us, Lord, to resist the hidden bribes and deceitful ways of the flesh, and instead, to walk in the light of Your truth. Grant us the strength to love genuinely, to be diligent in our work, and to serve You with fervent spirits (Romans 12:9-11). May our lives be a reflection of Your righteousness, not the fleeting rewards of this world. We trust in Your wisdom and guidance, Lord. Amen.
reflection: â€œConcealed Bribeâ€ does not endorse bribery, but points out the effectiveness of worldly and sinful methods, which God's people should not encourage (Romans 12:1-2). It is worth reading.
subject: Worldly Methods Vs. God's Way
verse_text: A gift in secret averts anger, and a concealed bribe, strong wrath.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; how much more_

_when he brings it with evil intent. _(Pro. 21:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Without faith it is impossible to please God. "Only justified people,

who are led by the Spirit of Christ can do go works. Without faith in

Christ as Mediator, good works do not please. Saving faith both in

God's existence and in His mercy for Christ's sake is the secret to

pleasing God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Lord Jesus, save me from my sin, which clings so closely, and give

me endurance to do Your will. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Without faith it is impossible to please God. "Only justified people, who are led by the Spirit of Christ can do go works. Without faith in Christ as Mediator, good works do not please. Saving faith both in God's existence and in His mercy for Christ's sake is the secret to pleasing God.
original_verse_text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; how much more when he brings it with evil intent.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that without faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ, it is impossible to please You. We confess that our good works, apart from the work of Your Spirit within us, are unacceptable in Your sight. Lord, grant us the gift of saving faith, that we may believe in Your existence and trust in Your mercy through Christ. May our lives be a reflection of our faith, bringing glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Without faith, it is impossible to please God. Only justified people, who are led by the Spirit of Christ, can do good works. Without faith in Christ as Mediator, good works do not please. Saving faith, both in God's existence and in His mercy for Christ's sake, is the secret to pleasing God.
subject: Pleasing God Through Faith
verse_text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; how much more when he brings it with evil intent.
